info.senderName: NWS NorthernIndiana (Northern Indiana and Northeastern Ohio)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 12 at 9:22PM EDT by NWS NorthernIndiana
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northwestern La Porte County through 900 PM CDT... At 822 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Porter, or 7 miles north of Chesterton, moving east at 35 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This strong thunderstorm will be near... Westville, Trail Creek and Pottawattamie Park around 940 PM EDT. Other locations in the path of this storm include Michigan City, Long Beach and La Porte. This includes the following highways... Interstate 80 in Indiana between mile markers 38 and 54. Interstate 94 in Indiana between mile markers 33 and 45. Interstate 94 in Michigan near mile marker 0. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle. A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 200 AM CDT for northwestern Indiana...and southwestern Michigan.
